questions.question: You have a completely free holiday with no plans. What do you do?

options.text: I need to call people and do something
Being alone is fine, but I usually end up meeting someone
I rest alone and reach out to others briefly if needed
Having no plans at all is the absolute best

questions.question: When you return home after a day of meeting many people?

options.text: I still have energy and can keep hanging out
I'm tired, but I feel good
I'm satisfied, but I definitely need some alone time
Exhausted... I don't want to see anyone for a while

questions.question: When you go to a gathering full of new people?

options.text: I tend to strike up conversations first and liven up the mood
I mingle naturally if someone talks to me first
I observe first and only talk to those I feel a connection with
I stay as quiet as possible and want to leave early

description: Questions to distinguish information perception (Intuition / Sensing)

questions.question: When learning a new concept, which explanation resonates with you most?

options.text: Explaining the 'why' through metaphors and concepts
Outlining the overall structure and core ideas first
Showing real-life cases and examples one by one
Organizing definitions, data, and procedures step-by-step

questions.question: When solving a problem, what do you think about more often?

options.text: What kind of possibilities could this lead to?
I could apply this to other areas as well
What is the most realistic method in the current situation?
What were the methods that proved successful in the past?

questions.question: During a conversation, I usually:

options.text: Talk a lot about ideas, metaphors, and possibilities
Naturally jump to related thoughts from the main topic
Talk mainly about personal experiences or actual cases
Tend to speak by organizing mainly around facts

description: Questions to distinguish decision-making criteria (Thinking / Feeling)

questions.question: When making an important decision, I usually:

options.text: Choose the option that is most logically sound
Prioritize objective criteria and only use emotions as reference
Adjust the decision while considering people's feelings
Think that how I feel about it is the most important factor

questions.question: When someone shares their struggles with me, I:

options.text: Start by suggesting solutions and organizing the situation
Analyze the cause of the problem for them
Empathize and help them process their emotions
Just listen and provide comfort

questions.question: What do I care about most in a conflict situation?

options.text: Who is right and who is wrong
Whether rational standards were followed
Whether the other person's feelings were hurt
Whether the relationship can be restored

description: Questions to distinguish lifestyle and planning tendencies (Judging / Perceiving)

questions.question: When preparing for work or an appointment, I:

options.text: Make a plan in advance and follow it exactly
Set a general framework and adjust as I go
Decide on the fly depending on the situation
Feel more comfortable doing things spontaneously without a plan

questions.question: When a deadline or schedule approaches, I:

options.text: Feel at ease only if I finish it well in advance
Proceed steadily with plenty of time to spare
Focus better when there is some pressure
Often end up doing everything right before the deadline

questions.question: When making travel or weekend plans, I:

options.text: Find joy in the process of creating an itinerary
At least decide on the places I want to visit in advance
Go with the flow once I arrive at the destination
Think leaving without any plans is the best

description: Questions to measure Novelty Seeking tendency

questions.question: If a sudden new opportunity arises...

options.text: I dive in immediately without much hesitation
I try it if it looks interesting
I decide after careful review
I prefer to stick with familiar methods

questions.question: When there is very little change in my daily routine, I:

options.text: Get bored and intentionally create changes
End up looking for something new
Tend to feel comfortable with it
Prefer not having any changes at all

questions.question: Faced with a choice that involves some risk, I:

options.text: Try it if it seems fun, even if it's risky
Try it if I feel I can handle the risk
Need safety to be guaranteed first
Avoid risky choices as much as possible

interpretation.description: Impulsive and prefers new stimuli
Pursues novelty and stability in balance depending on the situation
Prefers stable and familiar ways

description: Questions to measure Harm Avoidance tendency

questions.question: When placed in an uncertain situation, I:

options.text: Just go for it without much worry
Feel a bit nervous but can handle it
Weigh various possibilities carefully
End up worrying about the worst-case scenario first

questions.question: Faced with a task where I might make a mistake, I:

options.text: Think mistakes are just part of the experience
Am careful but don't worry too much
Prepare thoroughly to avoid making mistakes
Find it burdensome to even start for fear of making a mistake

questions.question: When thinking about the future, I:

options.text: Feel anticipation and excitement first
Feel a mix of good things and worries
Try to prepare realistically
Have anxious elements come to mind first

interpretation.description: High anxiety sensitivity, cautious, and avoids risk
Balances caution and challenge depending on the situation
Optimistic and has less fear regarding risks

description: Questions to measure Reward Dependence tendency

questions.question: How others perceive me is to me:

options.text: Something I hardly care about
Something I'm conscious of occasionally, but doesn't affect me much
Something I feel is important to some extent
Quite important and influences my behavior

questions.question: When I receive praise or recognition, I:

options.text: Think it's nice to have, but I'm fine without it
Feel good, but it doesn't change much for me
Tend to feel motivated by it
Find that it greatly influences my future actions

questions.question: In relationships with people, I:

options.text: Think it's fine to only reach out when needed
Value relationships but think independence is more important
Make an effort to maintain relationships consistently
Feel that emotional bonds and intimacy are very important

interpretation.description: Sensitive to others' reactions and values emotional bonds
Maintains a balance between relationships and independence
Independent and not easily swayed by external recognition

questions.question: When a task takes longer than expected, I:

options.text: Push through steadily until it's finished
Continue as much as possible even if it's hard
Judge whether to stop based on the situation
Quit early if it doesn't seem efficient

questions.question: When given a repetitive and boring task, I:

options.text: Carry it out silently until the end
Complain but ultimately complete it
End up taking frequent breaks in between
Lose interest and let go of it quickly

questions.question: When I experience multiple failures, I:

options.text: Keep trying by changing methods until it works
Rest a bit and then challenge myself again
Recalculate the probability of success
Feel it's better to find a different path

interpretation.description: Persistent and makes continuous efforts until goals are achieved
Adjusts between persisting and giving up based on the situation
Flexible but may feel burdened by long-term persistence

questions.question: When I need to set goals, I:

options.text: Set clear goals and take responsibility until the end
Set goals but adjust them according to the situation
Find my goals changing frequently with the flow
Respond as things come without clear goals

questions.question: When a problem arises, I usually:

options.text: View it as my responsibility and look for a solution
Analyze the situation and do what I can
Feel that external factors have a large influence
Feel like it's the fault of the environment or others

questions.question: Looking back on my life in the long run:

options.text: I feel my choices made me who I am today
I think I have generally set my own direction
I also feel like I've been dragged by circumstances
There were many things beyond my control

interpretation.description: High responsibility, self-control, and goal-oriented
Shows both self-direction and flexibility depending on the situation
Highly influenced by the external environment; may struggle with setting direction

questions.question: When I have to work with someone who has different opinions, I:

options.text: Try to find a compromise where we can both understand each other
Listen to the other's opinion and try to coordinate
Think I just need to perform my own role faithfully
Don't really make a special effort to align

questions.question: What do I value most in a conflict situation?

options.text: A resolution where no one gets hurt
The relationship not being severely damaged
The problem being settled
My position being clearly communicated

questions.question: When someone looks like they need help, I:

options.text: Help first even if it's not my job
Tend to help if I have the time and energy
Help if there is a request
Think it's better for everyone to focus on their own work

interpretation.description: High empathy; values cooperation and consideration
Adjusts between cooperation and individual standards based on the situation
Independent and tends to prioritize individual standards

questions.question: In life, what do I usually think I find meaning in?

options.text: Personal goals and achievements
Relationships with close people
Considering the values of society or the community
Meanings on a cosmic, philosophical, or spiritual dimension

questions.question: When looking at a problem, how do I mainly think?

options.text: Focus only on practical solutions
Solve it by cooperating with people
Try to understand the problem in a larger context
Explore the meaning and essence rather than the problem itself

questions.question: When looking at my own life or experiences, I:

options.text: Center them around my personal interests and goals
Mainly view them as connected to family and friends
Understand them within a social or environmental context
Reflect from the perspective of nature, the universe, or spiritual dimensions

interpretation.description: Transcends the self and tries to understand life from a broad perspective
Balances self and others depending on the situation and need
Tends to focus on personal and realistic perspectives

description: Whether you value stability or change more

questions.question: Faced with a choice that could significantly disrupt your current life, what do you do?

options.text: I choose new possibilities even if they are risky
It is worth calculating the risk
I feel there's no particular need to change
I avoid any possibility of breaking my current stability

questions.question: When you have to adapt to a new environment, you:

options.text: Feel fluttery and full of anticipation
Feel nervous, but it's not bad
Experience high stress until I get used to it
Would rather avoid it if possible

questions.question: If you had to choose between a predictable life and an unpredictable life?

options.text: An interesting life even with many variables
A life with some slight changes
A generally stable life
A predictable and stable life

description: Which value you prioritize more: relationships or the individual

questions.question: When making an important decision, I:

options.text: Prioritize what I want above all else
Consider the influence of others, though it's my choice
Think first about harmony with people around me
Don't make the choice if it will break relationships

questions.question: If someone could be disappointed by your choice?

options.text: I still can't change my choice
I explain it but stick to my choice
I consider the other person's position more
I avoid choices that disappoint others

questions.question: What do you feel is more important in the long run?

options.text: Living the life I want
Maintaining my autonomy
Having people to walk through life with
Stability and continuity in relationships

description: Where you place more value: achievement or balance

questions.question: My attitude toward work or goals is:

options.text: Results are the most important thing
Achieve results but don't overdo it
A sustainable pace is important
Life balance comes before achievement

questions.question: If you had to choose between rest and work?

options.text: I choose work even if I could rest
I prioritize work depending on the situation
I protect my rest time as much as possible
If rest is compromised, everything falls apart

questions.question: In which situation would you feel the most regret?

options.text: Finishing without having given my absolute best
Not pushing myself a bit further
Getting burnt out by overdoing it
Just being busy without having enjoyed life

description: Which you prioritize more: realistic efficiency or meaning

questions.question: When starting something new, what is your criterion?

options.text: I check if there are practical benefits and stability first
Benefits are important, but I also consider if there's experience or learning
I take on the challenge if there is meaning and value, even if benefits are lacking
Meaning and satisfaction are absolutely the most important; practical gains come later

questions.question: What if a job pays well but is meaningless?

options.text: I can do it if the conditions are good
It's possible if it's for a short term
It would be hard to do for a long time
I wouldn't choose it at all

questions.question: In what moment do you feel satisfaction?

options.text: When the actual results are good and goals are achieved
When results are good and it was a meaningful experience
I'm satisfied if it was meaningful, even if results were slightly lacking
I'm satisfied only when I feel meaning and value
